summary:
We need to produce JSON with keys: summary, business_intent, keywords (list). Must not list method names verbatim. Focus on class responsibility and state/behavior. Provide English.

Class PrimerAndAmpliconParameters holds common primer and amplicon design options for Primer3. Attributes include ranges for amplicon sizes, Tms, primer sizes, Tms, GC content, GC clamp, homopolymer limits, ambiguous base limits, dinucleotide runs, mask avoidance, number of primers to return, max homodimer/hairpin Tms. Provides helpers to compute max/min lengths and convert to Primer3 input tags.

So summary: encapsulates configuration parameters for primer and amplicon design, validates and provides derived values for Primer3.

Business intent: enable users to specify design constraints for PCR primers and amplicons, facilitating generation of Primer3 input and ensuring consistent parameter handling.

Keywords: primer design, amplicon, Primer3, melting temperature, GC content, homopolymer, dinucleotide, masked bases, parameter validation, input tags.

Make sure not to list method names verbatim. Provide JSON.

Summary: "A data container that stores and manages the range and limit settings used by Primer3 for designing PCR primers and amplicons, offering utility functions to compute size bounds and translate the configuration into Primer3‑compatible input tags."

Business intent: "Provide a single source of truth for primer/amplicon design constraints so that downstream workflows can reliably generate Primer3 commands and obtain primers that meet user‑defined specifications."

Keywords list: ["primer design", "amplicon size", "melting temperature", "GC content", "homopolymer limit", "dinucleotide run", "masked region avoidance", "Primer3 parameters", "input tag generation", "PCR primer constraints"]

Return JSON.

Check constraints: Do not list method names verbatim. We didn't. Good.
